    • Method Detail

      • getConfiguration

        public BJEConfig getConfiguration()
        Description copied from interface: HGStoreImplementation
        Each different storage mechanism provides its own configuration object with parameters that can be set before storage is initialized. This method returns the storage specific configuration object that must be cast to be appropriate concrete type.
        Specified by:
        getConfiguration in interface HGStoreImplementation

      • getBerkleyEnvironment

        public Environment getBerkleyEnvironment()

      • startup

        public void startup(HGStore store,
                    HGConfiguration config)
        Description copied from interface: HGStoreImplementation

        Starts the storage engine.

        This method is invoked after storage configuration parameters have been set and its purpose is to perform complete initialization for the underlying storage layer, possibly creating a new database instance. When this method returns, the storage should be ready for use.

        Specified by:
        startup in interface HGStoreImplementation

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: HGStoreImplementation

        Stops the storage engine.

        This method is invoked when the database instance is closed. It is expected to perform all necessary cleanup and closing of resources of the storage layer.

        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface HGStoreImplementation

      • store

        public HGPersistentHandle store(HGPersistentHandle handle,
                                byte[] data)
        Description copied from interface: HGStoreImplementation
        Store a raw data buffer and return its handle.
        Specified by:
        store in interface HGStoreImplementation
        Parameters:
        handle - The handle to use as identifier within the data space.
        data - The buffer to store. There is no limit to the size of this buffer, but it can't be null.
        Returns:
        The handle argument.

      • store

        public HGPersistentHandle store(HGPersistentHandle handle,
                                HGPersistentHandle[] link)
        Description copied from interface: HGStoreImplementation
        Store a primitive link and return its handle.
        Specified by:
        store in interface HGStoreImplementation
        Parameters:
        handle - The handle to use as the identifier of the link.
        link - The primitive link. Neither the array nor any of its element can be null.
        Returns:
        The handle argument.

      • getTransactionFactory

        public HGTransactionFactory getTransactionFactory()
        Description copied from interface: HGStoreImplementation

        Return the transaction factory associated with this storage instance. Storage implementations in HyperGraphDB are expected to be transactional and support snapshot isolation semantics.

        Specified by:
        getTransactionFactory in interface HGStoreImplementation

      • getIndex

        public <KeyType,ValueType> HGIndex<KeyType,ValueType> getIndex(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: HGStoreImplementation
        Get the HyperGraphDB index with the given name. Return null if no index with that name exists.
        Specified by:
        getIndex in interface HGStoreImplementation

      • getIndex

        public <KeyType,ValueType> HGIndex<KeyType,ValueType> getIndex(java.lang.String name,
                                                               ByteArrayConverter<KeyType> keyConverter,
                                                               ByteArrayConverter<ValueType> valueConverter,
                                                               java.util.Comparator<byte[]> keyComparator,
                                                               java.util.Comparator<byte[]> valueComparator,
                                                               boolean isBidirectional,
                                                               boolean createIfNecessary)
        Description copied from interface: HGStoreImplementation
        Retrieve the index with the given name, or create a new index if no index with that name exists.
        Specified by:
        getIndex in interface HGStoreImplementation
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the index. It must be unique for the storage layer.
        keyConverter - Converter to byte [] for the keys in this index. Necessary when creating a new index. If null, a default converter should be used.
        valueConverter - Converter to byte [] for the values in this index. Necessary when creating a new index. If null, a default converter should be used.
        keyComparator - A comparator for the keys in this index. If a non-null comparator is provided, it will be used by the storage implementation to main the keys in order.
        valueComparator - A comparator for the values in this index. This comparator will be used only when there are multiple values associated with a given key (i.e. "duplicate values").
        isBidirectional - If true a HGBidirectionalIndex will be created and returned, otherwise a normal HGIndex is returned.
        createIfNecessary - Only when this flag is true will an index be created. Otherwise, if this flag is false a no index with the given name exists then null will be returned.

      • removeIndex

        public void removeIndex(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: HGStoreImplementation
        Remove the index with the given name. Do nothing if not such index exists.
        Specified by:
        removeIndex in interface HGStoreImplementation
